rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TERM

classVariables.description: Topic variable for an event observation, which is the verbatim or pre-specified name of the event.
classVariables.label: Reported Term
classVariables.name: --TERM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--MODIFY

classVariables.description: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
classVariables.label: Modified Reported Term
classVariables.name: --MODIFY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DECOD

classVariables.description: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of the topic variable, --TERM, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).
classVariables.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
classVariables.name: --DECOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CAT

classVariables.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAT

classVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRESP

classVariables.description: Used to indicate whether the event described by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified events, null for spontaneously reported events.
classVariables.label: Pre-specified
classVariables.name: --PRESP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OCCUR

classVariables.description: Used to record whether a pre-specified event occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
classVariables.label: Occurrence
classVariables.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--STAT

classVariables.description: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre-specified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASND

classVariables.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is NOT DONE.
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BODSYS

classVariables.description: Body system or system organ class from a standard hierarchy (e.g. MedDRA) associated with an event. Example: GASTROINTESTINAL DISORDERS.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
classVariables.name: --BODSYS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LOC

classVariables.description: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event. Example: LEFT ARM for skin rash.
classVariables.label: Location of Event
classVariables.name: --LOC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SEV

classVariables.description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.
classVariables.label: Severity/Intensity
classVariables.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SER

classVariables.description: Is this is a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Serious Event
classVariables.name: --SER

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACN

classVariables.description: Describes changes made to the study treatment as a result of the event. Examples: DOSE INCREASED, DOSE NOT CHANGED.
classVariables.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
classVariables.name: --ACN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNOTH

classVariables.description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment.
classVariables.label: Other Action Taken
classVariables.name: --ACNOTH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REL

classVariables.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED.
classVariables.label: Causality
classVariables.name: --REL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RELNST

classVariables.description: An opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE."
classVariables.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
classVariables.name: --RELNST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PATT

classVariables.description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT.
classVariables.label: Pattern of Event
classVariables.name: --PATT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OUT

classVariables.description: Description of the outcome of an event. Examples: RECOVERED/RESOLVED, FATAL.
classVariables.label: Outcome of Event
classVariables.name: --OUT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAN

classVariables.description: Was the event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Involves Cancer
classVariables.name: --SCAN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCONG

classVariables.description: Was the event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
classVariables.name: --SCONG

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDISAB

classVariables.description: Did the event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
classVariables.name: --SDISAB

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDTH

classVariables.description: Did the event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Results in Death
classVariables.name: --SDTH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SHOSP

classVariables.description: Did the event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
classVariables.name: --SHOSP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SLIFE

classVariables.description: Was the event life threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Is Life Threatening
classVariables.name: --SLIFE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOD

classVariables.description: Did the event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Occurred with Overdose
classVariables.name: --SOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SMIE

classVariables.description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
classVariables.name: --SMIE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CONTRT

classVariables.description: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
classVariables.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
classVariables.name: --CONTRT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOX

classVariables.description: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.
classVariables.label: Toxicity
classVariables.name: --TOX

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOXGR

classVariables.description: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.
classVariables.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariables.name: --TOXGR

description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2018-06-29)
label: Events Observation Class
name: Events
